description: Ms. codex. Title from title page (fol. 1a). Physical description: 21 to 24 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with occasional use of red ; yāʾ for alif maqṣūrah. Thick European paper with watermark (Tre lune) ; glossy. Title on tail of text block. Short text on Iblīs on fol. 1a. The colophon is followed by a short saying attributed to Ibn Masʻūd (fol. 105a). Collation: Paper, fol. i, 106, i ; i (free endpaper) 1-10¹⁰ 11⁶ i (free endpaper) ; catchword on the verso of each leaf ; the second quire is numbered using Arabic numerals (fol. 11a). Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Ḥadīth 10". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥ 484". Origin: According to colophon, copied by ʻAlī ibn al-marḥūm shaykh al-Islām al-shaykh ʻĀmir al-SHBRLWī(?) al-Shāfiʻī for himself, and completed in the middle of Ṣafar 1064 [April 1654] (fol. 105a). Copyist: ʻAlī ibn ʻĀmir al-SHBRLWī(?) al-Shāfiʻī. Incipit: بسم ... به نستعين الحمد لله جاعل الملايكة رسلا اولي اجنهة ... فهذا تاليف لطيف جمعته في اخبار الملايكة الابرار واستوعبت فيه ما وردت به الاحاديث والاثار Explicit: والمعقبات فى قوله تعالى له معقبات من بين يديه ومن خلفه اتنهى
author: Suyūṭī, 1445-1505
extent: i, 106, i leaves: paper ; 213 x 154 (160 x 110) mm. bound to 210 x 155 mm.
provenance: Ownership statement in the name of Aḥmad al-Fayyūmī al-Mālikī on fol. 1a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
dlme_provenance_en: Ownership statement in the name of Aḥmad al-Fayyūmī al-Mālikī on fol. 1a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
creator: Suyūṭī, 1445-1505
سيوطي
subject: Angels—Islam—Early works to 1800
binding_note: Brown leather over paper pasteboards for upper and lower covers. Both covers are similarly stamped and tooled with a central scalloped mandorla with pendants on the vertical axis and an outer border consisting of fillets and a thin guilloche. Purlpe paper pastedowns and free endpaper. Rebacked.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
